aboutMe.starting: I am a Software Engineer & Full-Stack Developer with over 5 years of experience in designing and developing scalable, high-performance applications. My expertise lies in Java, Spring Boot, Vue.js, and microservices architecture. With a strong foundation in backend development, frontend design, and database optimization, I am passionate about building efficient, robust, and scalable systems. Looking ahead, I am eager to integrate IoT and microservices concepts to develop intelligent, automated, and globally connected systems that enhance everyday life.

whatIDo.title: What I Do
list: Design and develop microservices-based architectures to ensure scalability and flexibility.
Optimize backend performance & database queries for maximum efficiency.
Develop robust backend systems using Java and Spring Boot to support various business needs.
Work with modern technologies like Docker and Git to improve development and deployment workflows.
Follow SOLID principles and design patterns to create maintainable and scalable applications.
Implement RESTful APIs that ensure seamless communication between services.

careers.description: My last work experience was at the Institute for Advanced Studies in Basic Sciences, Zanjan, as a Software Engineer and IT Specialist. During this period, I designed and implemented several mini apps. Additionally, I contributed as technical support in organizing various academic conferences and events, ensuring that these events ran smoothly. For the implementation of these mini apps, I used new languages and technologies, most of which were based on PHP. Furthermore, during this time, I continued my studies in software development and developed several projects using my favorite language and framework (Spring and Vue.js), along with tools like Docker, Git, and databases such as MongoDB and PostgreSQL.

careers.name: MavaraTech Co.
careers.description:
My main focus during this period was on the advanced development of microservices systems, specifically concentrating on log management for these systems. Additionally, I worked with Behsat (Hamrah Aval) in the field of log management and was able to propose solutions to some of their challenges.

Mavaratech (Mavaratech Technology) specializes in the development of distributed systems and API management. My collaboration with this company lasted nearly a year, during which I worked on the development of the log management and monitoring system for their main product, Integropia. For this distributed system development, I used technologies such as Spring, Splunk, Redis, and others. Additionally, for four months, in collaboration with Hamrah Aval, I conducted studies on the software system logs of the company and implemented a tailored log management software solution based on those findings.

careers.name: FreeLance
careers.description:
In my second professional phase, I focused on advanced software architectures and began designing and developing some of the most important ones, particularly microservices architecture. During this time, I became familiar with more advanced and modern frameworks, technologies, and tools.

Most of the concepts, tools, and technologies I used in this period were related to distributed systems, especially in microservices. Some of the most important ones include:
points: Deeper exploration of databases (Relational: PostgreSQL, Non-relational: MongoDB)

Analysis of distributed system architectures and design patterns, including component communication, the importance of message brokers, and the structure and architecture of API Gateways in such systems.
Implementation of several relatively large systems using these architectures, deploying system components with Docker.

careers.name: Pardazeshgaran Behin Sayar Co.
careers.description:
I started my first work experience at this company with the patient management project at Abhar Hospital. During this time, I became extensively familiar with Java and the Spring framework and was able to choose these two powerful tools as my primary technologies.

In addition to Java and Spring, I also gained experience working with SQL databases (MySQL and especially PostgreSQL) and NoSQL databases (mainly MongoDB). Initially, I primarily used ORMs like Hibernate to handle database operations and did not work deeply with native database features.

Alongside backend technologies, I also got introduced to the Angular framework and implemented my second project (Sama System â€“ UI Builder project) at a beginner level.

academics.name: Shahid Beheshti University
academics.description:
During this period, in addition to continuing my studies in software architectures (particularly advanced architectures such as distributed systems architecture), I worked on implementing one of the most critical components of this architecture: distributed log management in the Data Science Laboratory (located at the university and under the supervision of my professor).

Before entering the master's program, I had already gained familiarity with various aspects of software development and had learned many practical concepts from the industry. However, I still had some weaknesses in researching and exploring cutting-edge topics. For this reason, I decided to pursue a master's degree in Information Technology Engineering to strengthen my R&D (Research and Development) skills.

After enrolling in the master's program at Shahid Beheshti University, I not only learned advanced software development concepts (such as Advanced Software Architecture, Large-Scale Systems, etc.), but I also had the opportunity to apply my academic studies practically in the industry through collaboration with MavaraTech.

academics.name: Institute for advanced study in basic science
academics.description: During this period, I began working as a specialist in software system design, development, and software architecture. At the same time, I participated in university projects and successfully added them to my list of completed projects. During my undergraduate studies, in addition to learning specialized concepts related to my field, I became familiar with the software development and production industry. This is why I consider this period to be the most crucial phase in shaping my passion for software development and my professional expertise. Alongside various training programs, I gained valuable experience in both academic and industrial fields.
